alert.note: Alert for Clinton (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 08 at 1:45PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Clinton County along the Saranac River from Plattsburgh to Morrisonville. * WHEN...Until 930 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 138 PM EST, Emergency management reported several ice jams along the river. - Low lying areas around MacDonough Park in Plattsburgh are currently flooded, and water is rising near the 22B bridge in Morrisonville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Ice jams are unpredictable, and rapid fluctuations in water levels are possible. Please obey all road closures and instructions from local authorities. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
